0: Riot police clashed with about 200 protesters at the U.S. Consulate in Sydney on Saturday as demonstrations against an anti-Islam film produced in the United States spread to Australia. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Ten Network television news showed a policeman knocked unconscious as the mostly male crowd hurled bottles and other missiles. Many of the protesters were wearing Muslim dress. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police used pepper spray against the protesters, who chanted "Obama, Obama, we love Osama" and waved placards saying "Behead all those who insult the Prophet." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A total of six police officers were injured, including two who were taken to a hospital. Two protesters were treated for police dog bites and 17 others for the effects of pepper spray, police said in a statement. There were no details of their condition. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Eight people were arrested on charges including assaulting police and resisting arrest. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police said they were unsure who organized the protest. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "There was little or no organization or control of what they were doing, and their actions were disgraceful," police Superintendent Mark Walton said in a statement.
